sources.name: World Happiness Report (2017)
sources.description:
Description:
Data published by

World Happiness Report 2017

Data publisher's source

Gallup World Poll surveys (life evaluation question)

Linkhttp://worldhappiness.report/
Retrieved24 April 2017
 

Additional information

Life evaluation was measured by the individual answers to the Cantril ladder question: “Please imagine a ladder, with steps numbered from 0 at the bottom to 10 at the top. The top of the ladder represents the best possible life for you and the bottom of the ladder represents the worst possible life for you. On which step of the ladder would you say you personally feel you stand at this time?”

variables.name: Life satisfaction in Cantril Ladder (World Happiness Report 2017)
variables.description: Average of survey responses to the 'Cantril Ladder' question in the Gallup World Poll. The survey question asks respondents to think of a ladder, with the best possible life for them being a 10, and the worst possible life being a 0.
